New Records: Chris Jordan became the first England player to take a men's T20I hat-trick.
Jos Buttler became the second player in a T20I World Cup to strike five sixes in an over.
Key Match Events: Chris Jordan took four wickets for 10 runs, including a hat-trick.
Jos Buttler scored an unbeaten 83 off 38 balls.
Adil Rashid took 2 wickets for 13 runs.
England won by 10 wickets with 62 balls remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Jordan expressed pride in his performance, especially given his unexpected call-up due to Jamie Overton's injury.
Jos Buttler's innings was seen as a release of frustration and a key factor in England's title defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in Bridgetown, Barbados.
England's net run rate was boosted to 1.992.
Adil Rashid equalled Stuart Broad's tally of 30 dismissals in T20 World Cups.
